results.title: Captains Courageous
results.creator_credit: Louis D Lighton, Victor Fleming and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This superb adaptation of Rudyard Kipling’s poignant masterpiece, set on the high seas stars Spencer Tracy as Manuel, the Portugese fisherman who teaches human values to a spoilt millionaire’s son, won him the Best Actor Oscar. The impressive cast also includes Mickey Rooney, Lionel Barrymore and Melvyn Douglas. Twelve year old Harvey Cheyne (Freddie Bartholomew) is travelling with his father aboard an ocean liner bound for Europe when he falls overboard and is rescued by Manuel who takes him aboard a New England fishing schooner captained by Disko. He is immediately put to work alongside the Captains’ son, Dan. The challenges that he faces and his slow and difficult mastery of new skills changes the boy from a brat into a gallant and brave apprentice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louis D Lighton, Victor Fleming and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: Captain Horatio Hornblower
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Raoul Walsh and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: C.S. Forester’s Napoleonic era naval hero, Captain Horatio Hornblower is made larger than life by an excellent performance from Gregory Peck. This is an epic film with plenty of broadside action and cannon fire as Hornblower’s man-o-war takes on the French and Caribbean pirateers. Hornblower’s sterness is eventually softened by true love in the guise of Lady Barbara Wellesley (Wellington’s sister), played by Virginia Mayo. This is an exciting, action-filled film with an eye for accurate historical detail.

results.title: Cannibal Tours
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Chris Owen and Laurence J. Henderson
results.brief_description: This witty, charming film follows a group of rich and bourgeois tourists on a journey along the Sepik River in the jungles of Papua New Guinea. The camera watches and assesses as the travellers meet the natives who live in the villages along the route. The two sides tell their own stories, revealing to the viewer the comparisons between them. Above all, “Cannibal Tours” affords us a glimpse of the real reasons why “civilised” people wish to encounter the “primitive”. Rated: PG

results.title: Can-can
results.creator_credit: Walter Lang, Jack Cummings and Suffolk-Cummings Productions
results.brief_description: It’s 1896 and the “naughty” Can-Can has been banned in Paris. That doesn’t stop a vivacious cafe owner, (Shirley MacLaine), from performing it anyway, much to the delight of her patrons. She’s been able to ignore the law because her clever lawyer, (Frank Sinatra), has a corrupt judge, (Maurice Chevalier), in his pocket. Their sweet setup abruptly changes when a new judge, (Louis Jourdan), decides to put a stop to this shocking behaviour. Little does he know, that the real fun and excitement is just beginning! Features three Cole Porter songs that were not in the original hit show, lavish sets, stunning costumes and plenty of high-stepping dance numbers. Like Paris in the summer, Can-Can sizzles!

results.title: Butterfly kiss
results.creator_credit: Michael Winterbottom, Julie Baines, Merseyside Film Production Fund and British Screen
results.brief_description: Amanda Plummer is Eunice, a dangerously unstable young woman who is roaming the countryside for her girlfriend, Judith. While hitchhiking the motorways of northern England, passing through towns and cities scarred by decade-long recession and unemployment, she meets Miriam (Saskia Reeves), a shy introverted woman who finds in Eunice the first person who has ever taken her seriously. Told in flashback by Miriam as she is interrogated by the police, “Butterfly Kiss”, is a powerful and disturbing examination of the psychologies of two people left discarded by the economic and social policies of Thatcherite Britain. A huge chasm emerges between the love shared by the two women for each other and the hatred and bitterness they share against a social order which ignores their existence and their desires. Though Eunice is obviously psychologically ill, Michael Winterbottom refuses any easy psychological or moral conclusions. For an audience torn between the intimate generosity shared between the two women, and the bloody results of their murderous rampage, the film proves both emotionally moving and intellectually confronting.

results.title: Bullitt
results.creator_credit: Peter Yates, Philip D'Antoni and Solar Productions
results.brief_description: Steve McQueen plays the title role as Frank Bullitt, a no-glitter, all-guts cop who is assigned to protect Chicago gangster Johnny Ross (Pat Renella), who is scheduled to testify against his mob cronies in San Francisco. But after Ross is attacked and later killed at the hospital, Bullitt conceals Ross’s death and begins to investigate the case himself, sensing something suspicious. One of the most memorable scenes in Bullitt is the celebrated car chase through the streets of San Francisco. McQueen, an expert automobile and motorcycle racer, does his own stunt driving as he propels his high-performance Mustang around and over San Francisco’s fabled hills. Cast includes Jacqueline Bisset, Robert Vaughn, Don Gordon and Robert Duvall.

results.title: Bullets over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Sweetland Films BV and Magnolia Productions
results.brief_description: A struggling writer gets the opportunity of his life to stage his latest play on Broadway. There is one catch however: he must cast the untalented mistress of a notorious gangster in the lead role. Overwhelmed by the chance of success, he overlooks critical factors looming in the wings, including a player who can’t act, a leading lady wanting to steal the spotlight, a leading man who is a compulsive eater and the gangster’s bodygaurd who wants to rewrite the play. Set in the 1920’s, Woody Allen’s film is enhanced by an excellent atmospheric soundtrack. The cast includes John Cusack, Mary-Louise Parker, Jennifer Tilly, Tracey Ullman, and Academy Award winner Dianne Wiest.

results.title: Bull Durham
results.creator_credit: Ron Shelton, Mark Burg, Thom Mount and Mount Company
results.brief_description: Kevin Costner, Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins turn in seriously sexy performances in this sensational baseball comedy. Charged with pulling the Durham Bulls ou of the longest losing streak in Carolina’s Baseball League history, Crash Davis’ (Costner) main challenge is to instruct, insult and inspire Eddie ‘Nuke’ Calvin (Robbins), their indisciplined but bullet-fast pitcher. Sarandon is the team’s groupie-cum-English Lit teacher who becomes the fly in the ointment after she catches Nuke’s eye and begins to distract him from Crash’s tuition with her own slightly bizarre set of off-field rules.

results.title: Bugsy Malone
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, David Puttnam, Alan Marshall and Goodtimes Enterprises
results.brief_description: A mad gangster musical set in the New York of the 1920s, a world of would-be hoodlums, show girls and dreamers. But there are no adults, only children. Bugsy, Blousey, Tallulah, Fat Sam, Fizzy, Leroy and Loney are some of the characters involved in a bitter gang war for possession of the dreaded “spurge gun”. Stars a very young Jodie Foster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Parker, David Puttnam, Alan Marshall and Goodtimes Enterprises

results.title: Bugsy
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson, Warren Beatty, Baltimore Pictures, Mulholland Productions and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: This is a bio-pic of legendary gangster Benjamin “Bugsy” Siegel (Warren Beatty), a mobster who had a vision for a gambling mecca in the Nevada desert. Directed by Barry Levinson (Diner, Rain man, Good morning Vietnam, Wag the dog), the film plots Bugsy’s rise to infamy as a crook and ruthless power broker in LA throughout the 1940s. It also documents Bugsy’s tumultuous relationship with Hollywood starlet, Virginia Hill (Annette Bening) who seduces Bugsy with Tinseltown glamour, despite the fact that he is married with children. Bugsy is depicted as a vain, sartorial womaniser whose violent ways make him feared and loathed amidst the mobsters with whom he fraternises. His ultimate extravagant dream, to see a bacchanalian oasis in the desert, is built with the funds of his ruthless mob boss Meyer Lanksky (Ben Kingsley). Harvey Keitel stars as gangster Mickey Cohen, with whom Bugsy falls into a longstanding business arrangement. The aesthetic of 1940s Hollywood - the cars, clothes, architecture and lifestyle - is lovingly re-created here in detail. Original music composed by Ennio Morricone. Winner of two Oscars for art direction and costume, the film was nominated for eight others.
